title: Mere expectation of checking work email after hours harms health of workers and families

title_detail.value: Mere expectation of checking work email after hours harms health of workers and families

summary: The study demonstrates that employees do not need to spend actual time on work in their off-hours to experience harmful effects. The mere expectations of availability increase strain for employees and their significant others -- even when employees do not engage in actual work during nonwork time.
